intro: Epilobium × salisianum, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a hybrid species belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, including North America. Epilobium × salisianum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in wet meadows, where it thrives in moist to wet conditions.
